text: Zulip doesn't have threads in the sense of Slack threads. But streams are meant to address this need. Usually, when you start a new discussion (like sharing a link, asking for feedback for your last pet project, etc.) you create a subject on the corresponding channel, and discussions start on this specific stream (# feedback > "my pet project"). There is also a view for those who prefer to have a "general stream" whith all discussions mixed with messages in chronological order, a bit like old Slack without threads.

text: For me the big plus for Zulip is that it is a solution to the problem: "On Slack if you see a message that later becomes a thread, it’s easy to miss the thread." as <@UA14TGLTC> said. For me it is the blocking "non-feature" with Slack, that make me want to use other tools (for Foc and my other communities). But maybe there are other tools that fill this need too, I am not stick to Zulip! :slightly_smiling_face:
